Changelog

This page documents the evolution of the Second Zeitgeist manifesto, tracking significant changes and updates to our principles and values over time.

ðŸ“œ Changelog

  • v1.0 2025-04-23

    First Official Release

    Initial manifesto release with complete timeline and project integration.

    • Initial manifesto release
    • Timeline visualization added
    • Projects section linked
  • v0.9 2025-03-10

    Beta Preview

    Public beta preview with core functionality implemented.

    • Beta preview launched
    • Quote carousel implemented
    • PDF export capability added
  • v0.8 2025-02-15

    Public Review Draft

    Draft circulated for public review and initial feedback.

    • Community feedback incorporated
  • v0.5 2025-01-20

    Planning Phase Complete

    Project planning completed and core values established.

    • Project planning initiated
    • Core values defined
    • Research phase completed
  • v0.1 2024-12-01

    Concept Development

    Initial concept development and brainstorming.

    • Concept development started
    • Initial brainstorming sessions
    • Vision document drafted
  • 2023-11-15

    Initial Release

    First version of our letter of values, establishing our core principles of Transparency, Equity, Innovation, and Responsibility.

    • First public statement of values
    • Four core principles defined
    • Initial community feedback
  • 2023-12-10

    Refined Equity Definition

    Updated our definition of equity to better reflect our commitment to addressing systemic inequalities.

    • Refined equity language
    • Added concrete examples
    • Incorporated academic research
  • 2024-01-05

    Added Community Focus

    Expanded our values to emphasize community engagement and participatory decision-making.

    • New community section
    • Participatory framework added
    • Governance model outlined
  • 2024-02-20

    Environmental Commitment

    Strengthened our Responsibility section with specific environmental sustainability commitments.

    • Carbon neutrality pledge
    • Ecological design principles
    • Environmental justice framework
  • 2024-04-01

    Accessibility Integration

    Added explicit language about digital accessibility as a key component of our Equity value.

    • WCAG 2.2 compliance commitment
    • Universal design principles
    • Assistive technology support

Our Journey

Timeline data is maintained in a Google Sheet that can be collaboratively edited.

Our Journey

Operation Just Cause (Panama)

1989

The U.S. invaded Panama to depose Manuel Noriega. Marked the beginning of Netu's birth-era conflict list.

Gulf War

1990 â€” 1991

Operation Desert Storm. U.S.-led coalition liberated Kuwait from Iraq. Signaled U.S. military dominance post-Cold War.

Operation Restore Hope (Somalia)

1992 â€” 1995

U.S. humanitarian mission turned into combat. Notoriously escalated with the 'Black Hawk Down' incident.

Operation Uphold Democracy (Haiti)

1994

U.S. intervened to restore democratically elected President Aristide following a coup.

Kosovo Bombings via NATO

1999

U.S. participated in NATO airstrikes against Yugoslavia over Kosovo. Highly controversial; Congress was split.

Afghanistan War

2001 â€” 2021

Launched post-9/11 under AUMF. Longest U.S. war. Personal toll: Netu's stepbrother returned broken.

Iraq War

2003 â€” 2011

Invasion justified by WMD claims. No formal declaration. Left a power vacuum, seeded extremism.

AFRICOM Drone Strikes & Raids (Ongoing)

2010 â€” Present

Covert drone operations across Africa. Rarely discussed in public. Bypassed most oversight.

Operation Odyssey Dawn (Libya)

2011

U.S. joined NATO airstrikes to enforce a no-fly zone during Libyan Civil War. Bypassed Congress.

Syria Airstrikes (Ongoing)

2014 â€” Present

Airstrikes against ISIS and others, claimed under post-9/11 AUMF. Yet ISIS did not exist in 2001.

Support for Saudi-led War in Yemen

2015 â€” Present

U.S. provided weapons, intelligence, and refueling to coalition. Caused massive humanitarian crisis.

Support for Ukraine (Ongoing)

2022 â€” Present

Massive U.S. aid to Ukraine following Russian invasion. Billions in arms, logistics, and intelligence.

Timeline data is maintained in a Google Sheet that can be collaboratively edited.
